text.p:
We present a spectroscopy study of a 3 quantum wells -microcavity (3QW/MC) structure that can be
interpreted by electron tunneling induced by the interaction between exciton-polaritons and Fermi-edge
polaritons. The 3QW/MC consists of three GaAs QW's (Fig.1a) located at the electromagnetic field antinodes of
the 2λ-wide MC confined photon (energy range E c ~1.52–1.56eV). The middle QW is empty and the two side
QW's are one-side delta-doped, having a (measured) 2DEG density of n e =1.1x10 11 cm -2 .

Reflection (R) and photoluminescence (PL) spectra were measured for the 3QW/MC and for three
reference structures: 1. A mixed type I-type II QW embedded in a microcavity (MTQW/MC), in which n e is
varied with laser excitation intensity. 2. A modulation doped QW embedded in a microcavity (MDQW/MC)
with a 2DEG density of n e =1.1x10 11 cm -2 . 3. A bare 3QW structure with layer widths and n e value that are
identical to those of the 3QW/MC (but it does not have distributed Bragg reflectors).

The R spectra of the MTQW/MC show narrow polariton lines for n e < 1x10 10 cm -2 . These polaritons
arise from the X hh1 , X lh1 and X hh1,2S excitons. In addition, a polariton line due to charged excitons (X hh1 -) appears
whose intensity increases with n e [1]. When n e >2x10 10 cm -2 all these exciton-polaritons disappear. The R
spectra of MDQW/MC show broad Fermi-edge polariton bands that are due to transitions at k F between the
filled e1 subband and the hh1 and lh1 subbands [2].

Comparing R and PL spectra of 3QW/MC with the reference samples, we observe two types of
polaritons in 3QW/MC: 1. Exciton-polaritons that result of the resonant interaction of the empty QW excitons
with the confined photon (narrow lines with widths ~0.5meV). 2. Fermi-edge polaritons resulting of the
resonant interaction between Fermi-edge transitions of the two doped QW's and the confined photon. These are
broader lines (widths reaching ~2meV). A few examples of R and PL spectra in the resonance range are shown
in Fig. 1b. The polariton peak energies vs. the detuning energy, δ = (E c – E(X hh1 )), are shown in Fig. 1c (heavy
dots mark exciton-polariton energies, dashed red lines – Fermi-edge polaritons).

A narrow polariton line that corresponds to charged excitons (X hh1 -) appears in the R and PL spectra of
3QW/MC. The measured ratio of PL intensities, I(X hh1 -) / I(X hh1 ), varies with δ by a factor of ~30 (Fig. 1d), and
it has two peaks at the coincidence energies of the Fermi-edge polariton with the exciton-polariton. This ratio
provides an estimate of the electron density in the empty (middle) QW. Its variation and the fact that no X hh1 -
line is observed in the bare 3QW structure, can be interpreted in terms of electron tunneling, over a long range
(optical wavelength), from the two doped QW's into the empty QW of the 3QW/MC.
